document.docAuthor: Silva, Jaqueline Santana Tavares Ferreira Da, Grazia, Jocelia & Barão, Kim Ribeiro
document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of Steleocoris Mayr, 1864 and Theloris Thunberg, 1783 (Hemiptera Pentatomidae), two poorly known African stink bugs

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of Steleocoris Mayr, 1864 and Theloris Thunberg, 1783 (Hemiptera Pentatomidae), two poorly known African stink bugs

mods:name.mods:namePart: Silva, Jaqueline Santana Tavares Ferreira Da

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Departamento de Zoologia, Instituto de Biociências, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, Porto Alegre, RS, Brazil. jocelia @ ufrgs. br; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 7027 - 5638
Unidade Educacional Penedo, Campus Arapiraca, Universidade Federal de Alagoas, Penedo, AL, Brazil. kim. barao @ penedo. ufal. br; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0003 - 1432 - 1756

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body yellowish; clavus and region between claval suture and radial vein brown; radial vein black; membrane of each hemelytron hyaline, brownish; scutellum with 1+1 paramedian brownish bands. Head wider than long, each mandibular plate shorter than or as long as clypeus. Prosternum sulcate; mesosternum carinate; and metasternum flat. Superior ridge of pygophore produced posteriorly, bisinuate; genital cup with superior process of dorsal rim flap-like; crown of parameres directed laterally, with dorsal and ventral processes forming a C-shape. Posterior margin of gonocoxites VIII setose; gonapophyses VIII visible, not covered by gonocoxites VIII carinate medially.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 24–34.
Theloris costata (Thunberg)
. 24 , dorsal habitus. 25 , ventral habitus. 26 , head in ventral view. 27 , meso- and metapleuron; 28–30 , pygophore in dorsal ( 28 ), posterior ( 29 ), and ventral ( 30 ) views. 31 , left paramere. 32–34 , phallus in dorsal ( 32 ), ventral ( 33 ), and lateral ( 34 ) views. Scale bars: 1, 1, 0.5, 1, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25 mm. Abbreviations: cj, conjunctiva; dr, dorsal rim; dsd, ductus seminis distalis ; p, paramere; pcj, process of conjunctiva; ph,phalloteca; sr, superior ridge; v, vesica; vr, ventral rim.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 1. Morphometric parameters measured [mean (minimum–maximum)] are given in millimeters, followed by sample size. Abbreviations: TL, total length; HL, head length; HW, head width; IOD, interocular distance; PL, pronotal length; PW, pronotal width; SL, scutellar length; SW, scutellar width; AW, abdominal width.

FIGURES 35–37.
Theloris costata (Thunberg)
. 35–36 , female genital plates. 37 , female genital plates and ectodermal ducts. Scale bars = 1 mm. Abbreviations: aaf, anterior annular flange; ch, chitinelipsen; cs, capsula seminalis ; drd, ductus receptaculi distal; drp, ductus receptaculi proximal; g8, gonapophyses VIII; g9, gonapophyses IX; gc8, gonocoxites VIII; gc9, gonocoxites IX; la8, laterotergites VIII; la9, laterotergites IX; paf, posterior annular flange; va, vesicular area.

FIGURES 38–39. Occurrence maps of
Steleocoris comma (Thunberg)
( 38 ) and
Theloris costata (Thunberg)
( 39 ). Circles on maps represent records obtained from museum observations, whereas stars represent georeferenced crowdsourced records obtained from iNaturalist.org.
